<L>502<pc>122-b<k1>as<k2>as<h>1
{@√1as@}¦ ({@ásti@} [<ls n="wg,636">636]</ls>; {@ā́sa@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} be, exist; be
present {%or%} on hand; take place, happen;
{@asti, āsīt,@} there is, there was, {%very frequent%}
{%at <ab>beg.</ab> of stories;%} <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} be, {%<ab>w.</ab> predicate possessive %} <lbinfo n="pos-sessive"/>
{%<ab>gen.</ab>, <ab>i. e.</ab>%} belong to; {@asti mama,@}
I have; {%observe that <ab>Skt.</ab> has no verb for%}
‘have’; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%most frequent as simple copula;%}
{%further, <ab>w.</ab> ppls: <ab>e. g.</ab>%} {@prāpto@} ‘si, art thou
come, didst thou come, <ls n="lan,9,1">9<sup>1</sup></ls>; {@hantavyo 'smi,@}
{%occidendus sum,%} <ls n="lan,3,2">3<sup>2</sup></ls>; {@śepāno 'smi,@} I have
sworn, <ls n="lan,97,7">97<sup>7</sup></ls>; {%redundantly%} [<ls n="wg,303">303b<sup>4</sup></ls> end]: {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%}
{@tathā_anuṣṭhite sati,@} it being thus performed, <lbinfo n="per-formed,"/>
 <ls n="lan,35,17">35<sup>17</sup></ls>; {%so%} <ls n="lan,37,13">37<sup>13</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,39,16, 22">39<sup>16, 22</sup></ls>; {@prahṛṣṭaḥ@}
[Page123-a+ 50]
{@san,@} being pleased, <ls n="lan,48,12">48<sup>12</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} {%<ab>w.</ab> advs:%}
{@tūṣṇīm āsīt,@} kept silent; {@evam astu,@} so
be it; {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@prādus,@} {%see <ab>s. v.</ab>;%} <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} become,
<ls n="lan,96,19">96<sup>19</sup></ls>. [<ab>w.</ab> {@ás-ti, s-ánti,@} ‘is, are,’ <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἔσ-τι</lang>,
‘ís, exists,’ <lang n="greek">εἰσί</lang>, Doric <lang n="greek">ἐντί, *ἅντι</lang>, ‘are,’

<ab>Eng.</ab> {%is;%} cognate are {%a-m, ar-t, are.%}]

<L>503<pc>123-a<k1>as<k2>as<h>2
{@√2as@}¦ ({@ásyati, -te; ā́sa; asiṣyáti; astá;@}
{@ásitum; asitvā́; -ásya@}). throw, cast,
shoot; throw aside. [<ab>cf.</ab> {@así,@} ‘the brandished’  <lbinfo n="bran-dished’"/>

{%*aslea,%} ‘die,’ like <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Würfel,%} ‘die,’ <ab>fr.</ab>
{%werfen,%} ‘throw.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ vy-ati,@} throw over, cross.
<div n="p"/>{@+ abhi,@} throw (one's self) upon, direct
(one's attention) to, study. [for <ab>mg</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab>
<lang n="greek">προσέχειν</lang> without <lang n="greek">τὸν νοῦν</lang>.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ ni,@} throw down; deposit; commit.
<div n="p"/>{@+ pari-ni,@} throw down over, stretch
over.

<div n="p"/>{@+ vi,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} cast asunder; cast {%or%} throw
away; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} break in pieces, <ls n="lan,70,14">70<sup>14</sup></ls>.

<L>704<pc>128-b<k1>iti<k2>i/ti
{@íti,@}¦ {%<ab>adv.</ab> see%} <ls n="wg,1102">1102a</ls>. <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} in this way, thus;

upon saying “Yes,” <ls n="lan,4,2">4<sup>2</sup></ls>; {@sa pṛṣṭavān kau@}
{@yuvām iti,@} he asked, “Who are ye,” <ls n="lan,45,5">45<sup>5</sup></ls>;
{@evam astu iti tau dhāvitau,@} with the
words, “So be it,” the two ran off, <ls n="lan,45,16">45<sup>16</sup></ls>;
{%so%} <ab>RV.</ab>, <ls n="lan,85,12">85<sup>12</sup></ls>; {%so%} <ab>MS.</ab>, <ls n="lan,92,15">92<sup>15</sup></ls>; ity {@ākarṇya,@}
on hearing (so, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) the preceding ślokas,
<ls n="lan,17,16">17<sup>16</sup></ls>; {%<ab>cf.</ab>%} <ls n="lan,18,10">18<sup>10</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2a.@} {%designating something%}
{%as that which was, or under the circumstances%}
{%might have been said or thought or intended%}
{%or known, sometimes%} (<ls n="lan,46,16">46<sup>16</sup></ls>) {%preceding it, but%}
{%usually following it:%} {@martavyam iti,@} at the
thought, “I must die,” <ls n="lan,29,9">29<sup>9</sup></ls>; {@gardabho@}

<L>993<pc>138-a<k1>ka<k2>ka/<h>1

{@nīrujaḥ kim auṣadhais,@} what has a well
man (to do) with medicines, <ls n="lan,22,3">22<sup>3</sup></ls>; {%so%} <ls n="lan,32,21">32<sup>21</sup></ls>,
<ls n="lan,51,20">51<sup>20</sup></ls>; ka {%<ab>w.</ab> particles:%} {@ko nāma,@} who indeed; <lbinfo n="in-deed;"/>

{@cana@} {%in such collocations becoming lost%}), {@ka@}

<L>1037<pc>139-b<k1>kam<k2>kam

<L>1169<pc>142-b<k1>kf<k2>kf<h>1
{@√1kṛ@}¦ ({%Vedic,%} {@kṛṇóti, kṛṇuté@} [<ls n="wg,715">715]</ls>; {%later,%}
{@karóti, kuruté@} [<ls n="wg,714">714]</ls>; {@cakā́ra, cakré;@} {%<ab>V.</ab>%}
{@ákar, ákṛta@} [<ls n="wg,831">831,</ls> <ls n="wg,834">834a</ls>]; {%later,%} {@ákārṣīt;@}
{@kariṣyáti; kṛtá; kártum; kṛtvā́; -kṛ́tya;@}
{@kriyáte; cíkīrṣati; kāráyati, -te@}). do,
make, {%in the various meanings and uses of%}
{%these words; thus,%}
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—1.@} perform, <ls n="lan,59,21">59<sup>21</sup></ls>; accomplish; cause;
effect; prepare, <ls n="lan,83,15">83<sup>15</sup></ls>; undertake, <ls n="lan,52,2">52<sup>2</sup></ls>;
commit, <ls n="lan,29,12">29<sup>12</sup></ls>; show: {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} honor, <ls n="lan,5,6">5<sup>6</sup></ls>; familiarity, <lbinfo n="fami-liarity,"/>
 <ls n="lan,9,17">9<sup>17</sup></ls>; compassion, <ls n="lan,21,19">21<sup>19</sup></ls>; love, <ls n="lan,42,18">42<sup>18</sup></ls>;
favor, <ls n="lan,52,21">52<sup>21</sup></ls>; contempt, <ls n="lan,54,16">54<sup>16</sup></ls>; attend to:
an affair, <ls n="lan,11,4">11<sup>4</sup></ls>; engage in: trade, <ls n="lan,46,11">46<sup>11</sup></ls>; a
quarrel, <ls n="lan,42,19">42<sup>19</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} do something (good {%or%}
[Page143-a+ 50]
bad) for a person ({%<ab>gen.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,3,2">3<sup>2</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,9,15">9<sup>15</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@}
make {%or%} procure for another, <ls n="lan,82,4">82<sup>4</sup></ls>; grant;
{%--middle:%} get for one's self; assume:
human voice, <ls n="lan,3,14">3<sup>14</sup></ls>; take on: form {%or%} shape,
<ls n="lan,48,3">48<sup>3</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,49,6">49<sup>6</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} execute; follow: advice,
<ls n="lan,40,7">40<sup>7</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} work over, prepare: food, <ls n="lan,68,3">68<sup>3</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—6.@} accomplish; be good for, <ls n="lan,18,5">18<sup>5</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—7.@}
make: a sound, <ls n="lan,26,17">26<sup>17</sup></ls>; utter: the syllable
om, <ls n="lan,60,8, 9">60<sup>8, 9</sup></ls>;
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—8.@} ({%like <ab>Eng.</ab>%} do {%in%} don, doff) put in
{%or%} on; {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>loc.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,81,1">81<sup>1</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,43,6">43<sup>6</sup></ls>; set, <ls n="lan,105,14">105<sup>14</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab>%}
{%adverbs: see%} {@agratas, amā, āvis, tiras,@}
{@puras, bahis;@} <div n="2"/>{@—9.@} make a person ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%})
to be something ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,79,12">79<sup>12</sup></ls>; transform
into, <ls n="lan,40,13">40<sup>13</sup></ls> <ab>ff.</ab>; render, {%<ab>w.</ab> factitive predicate%}
{%<ab>acc.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,18,8">18<sup>8</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab> the predicate in composition%}
[<ls n="wg,1094">1094]</ls>: {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} {@sajjī-kṛ,@} make ready, <ls n="lan,34,17">34<sup>17</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—10.@} {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>adv.</ab> in%} {@-dhā,@} divide in parts,
<ls n="lan,57,10">57<sup>10</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—11.@} do, go to work, proceed, <ls n="lan,37,8">37<sup>8</sup></ls>;
{%<ab>pass.</ab> <ab>impers.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,30,16">30<sup>16</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—12.@} do, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} sacred
work; {%with%} {@karma,@} <ls n="lan,97,2">97<sup>2</sup></ls>; {%without%} {@karma@}
({%like%} <lang n="greek">ῥέζειν θεῷ</lang> {%and%} facere), to sacrifice,
<ls n="lan,93,12">93<sup>12</sup></ls>; {%--see also%} {@kṛta.@}
<div n="1"/>{%--<ab>desid.</ab>%} desire to perform; {%<ab>ppl.</ab>%} [<ls n="wg,1037">1037]</ls>,
{@cikīrṣita,@} that which is sought to be done,
intention.
<div n="1"/>{%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to do {%or%} make {%or%} be done
{%or%} made; see to it that a thing takes
place, <ls n="lan,16,1">16<sup>1</sup></ls>; {%<ab>pass.</ab>%} {@tena sa praṇāmaṃ@}
{@kāritas,@} by him he was caused to make
obeisance, <ls n="lan,36,7">36<sup>7</sup></ls>; {%<ab>caus.</ab> <ab>equiv.</ab> to simple verb,%}
<ls n="lan,26,5">26<sup>5</sup></ls>.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">αὐτο-κρά-τωρ</lang>, ‘self-actor, independent’; <lbinfo n="indepen-dent’;"/>
 <lang n="greek">Κρό-νος</lang>, an old harvest-god, ‘Perficus, <lbinfo n="‘Per-ficus,"/>
 the Completer, Ripener’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%cer-us,%}
‘creator’; <lang n="greek">κραίνω</lang>, ‘accomplish’; <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%creāre,%} ‘create’: {%see%} {@kratu:@} <ab>orig.</ab> rootform, <lbinfo n="root-form,"/>
 perhaps, {@skṛ,@} <ls n="wg,1087">1087d</ls>.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ adhi,@} put over; put in office.
<div n="p"/>{@+ apa,@} put off; injure, {%<ab>opp.</ab> of%} {@upakṛ.@}
<div n="p"/>{@+ aram@} {%or%} {@alam,@} {%see these words.%}
<div n="p"/>{@+ ā,@} bring hither, <ls n="lan,74,10">74<sup>10</sup></ls>; prepare, fashion,
make.
<div n="p"/>{@+ vy-ā,@} separate, analyse.
<div n="p"/>{@+ upa,@} bring something to some one; do
a service, act as an auxiliary, {%<ab>opp.</ab> of%}
{@apakṛ.@} [<ab>w.</ab> the use of {@upa,@} <ab>cf.</ab> that of {%sub%}
in {%subvenire,%} ‘aid.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ pari,@} ({%<ab>poss.</ab>%} surround, deck, {%and so%})
make ready; adorn.
[Page143-b+ 50]
<div n="p"/>{@+ pra,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} carry forward, accomplish;
effectuate, cause; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} set before;
put before one, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} make the subject of
discussion {%or%} treatment; {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@buddhim,@} put
a plan before one's self, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} decide.
<div n="p"/>{@+ prati,@} work against, counteract.
<div n="p"/>{@+ sam,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} put together; conficere,
prepare; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} treat according to the
sacred usages, administer a sacrament
to, {%see%} {@saṃskāra;@} consecrate, <ls n="lan,106,3">106<sup>3</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@}
adorn.
<LEND>

{@vyatikara,@} ‘disaster.’]

{@√kram@}¦ ({@krā́mati@} [<ls n="wg,745">745d</ls>], {@krámate; cakrā́ma,@} <lbinfo n="ca-krā́ma,"/>
{@cakramé; ákramīt; kramiṣyáti,@}
{@-te, kraṃsyáte; krāntá@} [<ls n="wg,955">955a</ls>]; {@krámitum,@} <lbinfo n="krámi-tum,"/>
{@krā́ntum; kramitvā́, krāntvā́;@}
{@-krámya; kramyáte; kramáyati, krāmáyati@} <lbinfo n="krām-áyati"/>
[Page145-b+ 50]
[<ls n="wg,1042">1042c<sup>2</sup></ls> <ab>mid.</ab>]). step; go; go towards. <lbinfo n="to-wards."/>

<div n="p"/>{@+ ati,@} step beyond; excel; overcome.
<div n="p"/>{@+ sam-ati,@} excel. [{@sam@} <ab>intens.</ab>, <ls n="wg,1077">1077b</ls>
end.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ ā,@} step near to; come upon; attack;
overpower.
<div n="p"/>{@+ ud,@} go out; depart (of the vital spirit);
{%<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to disembark.
<div n="p"/>{@+ abhy-ud,@} {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to step out.
<div n="p"/>{@+ upa,@} step unto; approach, <ls n="lan,3,10">3<sup>10</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ nis,@} go out.
<div n="p"/>{@+ parā,@} step forth; advance boldly;
{%and so,%} show one's strength {%or%} courage.
[hence {@parākrama,@} ‘valor’: <ab>cf.</ab> {@kram +@}
{@vi.@}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ pari,@} go around, circumambulate.
<div n="p"/>{@+ para,@} step forward; set out; start
from.
<div n="p"/>{@+ vi,@} move away {%or%} on; proceed; attack
boldly; {%and so,%} show one's courage.
[hence {@vikrama,@} ‘valor’: <ab>cf.</ab> {@kram +@}
{@parā.@}]

(a zodiacal sign, said of the sun).

({%<ab>intrans.</ab>%}): of time, <ls n="lan,20,3">20<sup>3</sup></ls>; of days, <ls n="lan,29,13">29<sup>13</sup></ls>;

condition: {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@pañcatvam,@} go to dissolution, <lbinfo n="dissolu-tion,"/>

{@guhyaka,@}¦ {%<ab>m.</ab>%} one of a class of demigods,
who, like the Yakshas, wait on Kubera,
god of wealth, and, dwelling in mountain
caverns ({@guhā@}), keep his treasures. [so
named from their living in caverns or
hidden places: <ls n="wg,1222">1222.</ls>]

<L>1483<pc>154-b<k1>car<k2>car

{@caritvā́; -cárya; caryáte; cāráyati,@} <lbinfo n="cārá-yati,"/>

{%see <ab>s. v.</ab>%} [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">περι-τελ-λομένων ἐνιαυτῶν</lang>, ‘as

<L>1708<pc>162-a<k1>tan<k2>tan<h>1
{@√1tan@}¦ ({@tanóti, tanuté; tatā́na, tené@}
[<ls n="wg,794">794e</ls>]; {@átānīt; taṃsyáte; tatá; tántum;@}
{@tatvā́; -tátya; tāyáte@} [<ls n="wg,772">772]</ls>). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@}
stretch, {%<ab>trans.</ab> and <ab>intrans.</ab>;%} extend, reach;
spread over; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} continue, endure, <ls n="lan,79,13">79<sup>13</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—3.@} stretch (a weft {%or%} a line); continue
(the line of a family); <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} {%metaphorically,%}
of sacrifice and supplication (which are
compared with a weft), perform, make.
[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">τάνυμαι</lang>, ‘stretch’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%tenēre,%} ‘hold,’
{%tendere,%} ‘stretch’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%ϸenian,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%dehnen,%}
‘stretch’: see also {@tanu.@}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ ā,@} spread over; overspread ({%<ab>esp.</ab>%} with
light), beshine; stretch (a bow).
<div n="p"/>{@+ pari,@} stretch around; surround; envelope. <lbinfo n="en-velope."/>

<div n="p"/>{@+ vi,@} stretch out; spread out, cover;
{@vitata,@} stretched, hung, dependent, <ls n="lan,92,11">92<sup>11</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ sam,@} hold together, {%<ab>intrans.</ab>;%} bind together; <lbinfo n="to-gether;"/>
 make continuous; {@saṃtata,@} ({%just%}
{%like <ab>Lat.</ab>%} con-tinens) uninterrupted.

<lang n="greek">δέδωκα</lang>, ‘granted, gave’; <lang n="greek">ἔ-δωκ-α</lang> is an imperfect  <lbinfo n="im-perfect"/>
indicative without thematic vowel,
corresponding to {@*á-dāś-am;@} but both
Greek forms became connected in the
popular mind with <lang n="greek">δίδωμι</lang>, ‘give.’]

<L>2149<pc>175-b<k1>DA<k2>DA<h>1
{@√1dhā@}¦ ({@dádhāti, dhatté@} [<ls n="wg,668">668]</ls>; {@dadhaú,@}
{@dadhé; ádhāt, ádhita@} [<ls n="wg,884">884]</ls>; {@dhāsyáti,@}
{@-te;@} {%<ab>V.</ab>%} {@-dhita,@} {%later%} {@hitá@} [<ls n="wg,954">954c</ls>]; {@dhā́tum;@}
{@dhitvā́; -dhā́ya; dhīyáte; dídhiṣati,@}
{@dhítsati; dhāpáyati@} [<ls n="wg,1042">1042d</ls>]).
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—1.@} put, <ls n="lan,86,10">86<sup>10</sup></ls>; set; lay, <ls n="lan,39,14">39<sup>14</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} put
in a place, bring to, {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@tatra,@} <ls n="lan,85,19">85<sup>19</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>loc.</ab>,%}
<ls n="lan,89,8">89<sup>8</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,95,5">95<sup>5</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>dat.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,83,1">83<sup>1</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} put upon, direct  <lbinfo n="di-rect"/>
towards; {@dharme dhā manas,@} set the
heart on virtue, <ls n="lan,66,7">66<sup>7</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} put something
for a person {%(<ab>dat.</ab>), <ab>i. e.</ab>%} bestow upon him,
grant him, <ls n="lan,84,1">84<sup>1</sup></ls>, <ab>RV.</ab> x. <ls n="wg,125">125.</ls> 2; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} put in
a position, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} appoint, constitute, {%<ab>w.</ab> double%}
{%<ab>acc.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,88,12">88<sup>12</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—6.@} make, cause, produce;
<div n="2"/>{@—7.@} hold, keep, <ls n="lan,86,6, 9">86<sup>6, 9</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—8.@} {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} take to
one's self, receive, obtain, win; {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} {@garbhaṃ @} <lbinfo n="gar-bhaṃ"/>
{@dhā,@} conceive fruit in the womb,
<ls n="lan,92,12">92<sup>12</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—9.@} {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} assume, <ls n="lan,19,7">19<sup>7</sup></ls>; maintain;
<div n="2"/>{@—10. hita,@} {%see <ab>s. v.</ab>;%} <div n="2"/>{@—11.@} {%<ab>desid.</ab> <ab>act.</ab>%} desire
to grant; {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} desire to win.
<div n="1"/>[The original meaning of the root is
‘put’; but, from the proethnic period, a
secondary development in the line (‘set,’
‘establish,’ and so) ‘make,’ ‘do,’ is clear.
The secondary <ab>mg</ab> has even won the more
prominent place in Germanic and Slavic.
<div n="1"/>For the primary <ab>mg</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">τίθημι</lang>, ‘put’
(the parallelism of its <ab>mg</ab>s is remarkable
--<lang n="greek">θέσαν, λίθον</lang>, ‘they set a stone’; <lang n="greek">θέσθαι</lang>
<lang n="greek">υἱόν</lang>, ‘conceive a son,’ <ab>etc.</ab>, <ab>etc.</ab>); <ab>Lat.</ab> {%abde-re,%} <lbinfo n="ab-de-re,"/>
‘put off {%or%} away,’ and {%con-de-re,%} ‘put
together, construct, establish’; <ab>Eng.</ab> do,
[Page176-a+ 50]
‘put,’ in the contract forms {%doff, don, dup;%}
<ab>Ger.</ab> {%weg-thun,%} ‘do away {%or%} put away.’
<div n="1"/>For the secondary <ab>mg</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">θεῖναί τινα</lang>
<lang n="greek">βασιλέα</lang>, ‘make one a king’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%dōn hine%}
{%tō cyninge,%} ‘make him a king’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%fīo,%}
‘am made’; <ab>Eng.</ab> {%do, deed;%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%thun,%}
‘do’; Slavic {%dĕ-lo,%} ‘deed’: observe that
{%fi-eri,%} ‘become,’ is to {%fă-c-ere,%} ‘make,’ as
{%ī-re (√ja),%} ‘go,’ is to {%jă-c-ere,%} ‘make to
go, throw.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ antar,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} put into the interior of
a thing; {%and so%} <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} hide, conceal.
<div n="p"/>{@+ api,@} put close upon; cover (a jar with
its lid); {@ápihita,@} closed up. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἐπιτίθημι</lang>,
‘put upon.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ abhi,@} put on; put a name upon, designate; <lbinfo n="desig-nate;"/>
 address; speak to, <ls n="lan,43,10">43<sup>10</sup></ls>; say, <ls n="lan,42,20">42<sup>20</sup></ls>;
{@abhihitam,@} (it was) said, <ls n="lan,38,13">38<sup>13</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ ava,@} put down in; {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} duck ({%<ab>trans.</ab>%})
into the water; {@ávahita,@} fallen into the
water; {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to be laid in.
<div n="p"/>{@+ ā,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} put {%or%} lay {%or%} set in {%or%} on, {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>loc.</ab>,%}
<ls n="lan,77,1">77<sup>1</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,79,12">79<sup>12</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,88,15">88<sup>15</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,90,5">90<sup>5</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,102,21">102<sup>21</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} put on
(wood on the fire), <ls n="lan,82,15">82<sup>15</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} set for
one's self on (the hearth a sacred fire),
<ls n="lan,95,12">95<sup>12</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} put on one's self, take on,
<ls n="lan,74,6">74<sup>6</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} take, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} take away, <ls n="lan,87,10">87<sup>10</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ vy-ā,@} {%<ab>pass.</ab>%} be separated; be uncomfortable  <lbinfo n="uncom-fortable"/>
{%or%} sick.
<div n="p"/>{@+ sam-ā,@} put upon; {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@manas,@} concentrate  <lbinfo n="concen-trate"/>
the mind upon one thing; {@samāhita,@}
intent, eager, <ls n="lan,1,13">1<sup>13</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ upa-sam-ā,@} set together (wood) unto
(an already burning fire), put (fuel) on,
<ls n="lan,100,16">100<sup>16</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,105,10">105<sup>10</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ upa,@} put on ({%<ab>esp.</ab>%} a brick {%or%} stone
on the sacred fire-altar {%or%} enclosure),
<ls n="lan,96,8">96<sup>8</sup></ls> <ab>ff.</ab>
<div n="p"/>{@+ ni,@} lay down, <ls n="lan,87,8">87<sup>8</sup></ls>; set down (sacred
fire), <ls n="lan,85,6">85<sup>6</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@kriyām,@} put labor upon
({%<ab>loc.</ab>%}), take pains with, <ls n="lan,19,14">19<sup>14</sup></ls>; {@nihita,@} put
down, lying low, <ls n="lan,70,19">70<sup>19</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ saṃ-ni,@} lay down together; put together; <lbinfo n="to-gether;"/>
 {%<ab>pass.</ab>%} be near together; {@saṃnihita,@} <lbinfo n="saṃni-hita,"/>
near, impending, <ls n="lan,25,15">25<sup>15</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ pari,@} put around; {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} put (part of a
sacrificial fence) around (an altar), <ls n="lan,105,13">105<sup>13</sup></ls>;
put around one's self, put on, (garments)
<ls n="lan,103,19">103<sup>19</sup></ls>, (shoes) <ls n="lan,45,11">45<sup>11</sup></ls>; clothe.
<div n="p"/>{@+ puras,@} {%see <ab>s. v.</ab>%}
[Page176-b+ 50]
<div n="p"/>{@+ pra,@} set forward. [<ab>cf.</ab> {@pradhana, pradhāna.@} <lbinfo n="pra-dhāna."/>
]
<div n="p"/>{@+ vi,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} part, mete out, distribute;
<div n="2"/>{@—2.@} spread abroad, <ab>RV.</ab> x. <ls n="wg,125">125.</ls> 3; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} ({%like%}
{%<ab>Lat.</ab>%} dis-pōnere) arrange, determine; prescribe, <lbinfo n="pre-scribe,"/>
 <ls n="lan,59,7">59<sup>7</sup></ls>; {@vihita,@} ordained, <ls n="lan,14,4">14<sup>4</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} lay
out, make, build; prepare, <ls n="lan,54,18">54<sup>18</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} accomplish, <lbinfo n="ac-complish,"/>
 <ls n="lan,56,12">56<sup>12</sup></ls>; make, do ({%in a great%}
{%variety of applications%}); {@vadhaṃ vidhā,@}
do slaughter, slay, <ls n="lan,32,14">32<sup>14</sup></ls>; {@pūjāṃ vidhā,@} do
{%or%} show honor, <ls n="lan,28,13">28<sup>13</sup></ls>; {@pravṛttiṃ vidhā,@}
make an advance into, {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>loc.</ab>,%} expose one's
self to, <ls n="lan,20,12">20<sup>12</sup></ls>; {@upāyaṃ vidhā,@} employ an
expedient, <ls n="lan,39,2">39<sup>2</sup></ls>; {@kiṃ vidheyam,@} what's to
be done, <ls n="lan,31,5">31<sup>5</sup></ls>; {@tathā vidhīyatām,@} so let
it be done, <ls n="lan,11,4">11<sup>4</sup></ls>; {@yathā…, tan mayā vidheyam,@} <lbinfo n="vi-dheyam,"/>
I must take such a course, that…,
<ls n="lan,37,6">37<sup>6</sup></ls>; {%<ab>cf.</ab>%} <ls n="lan,38,22">38<sup>22</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ śrad,@} {%see%} {@śrad.@}
<div n="p"/>{@+ sam,@} put together, unite; embroil in,
{%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>loc.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,73,14">73<sup>14</sup></ls>.

{@√dhvaṃs@}¦ {%or%} {@dhvas@} ({@dhváṃsati, -te; dadhváṃsa,@} <lbinfo n="da-dhváṃsa,"/>
{@dadhvasé; ádhvasat; dhvastá;@}
{@-dhvásya@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} fall to dust, perish;
{@dhvasta,@} exhausted, hurt, impaired; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@}
vanish, be off; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%only in <ab>ppl.</ab>%} {@dhvasta,@}
bestrewn, covered over, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} with dust.

{%dysig,%} ‘foolish,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%dizzy,%} Old High <ab>Ger.</ab>

{@ápaptat; patiṣyáti; patitá; pátitum;@}
{@patitvā́; -pátya; pātáyati, -te@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} fly;
move swiftly through the air; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} descend, <lbinfo n="de-scend,"/>
 let one's self down; cast one's
self at, <ls n="lan,26,8">26<sup>8</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} fall down, tumble down,
<ls n="lan,34,8">34<sup>8</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,40,2, 5">40<sup>2, 5</sup></ls>; fall (morally), fall from one's
caste; fall down (dead); <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} fall upon,
be directed to, <ls n="lan,13,6">13<sup>6</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} fall {%or%} get into,
<ls n="lan,22,8, 9">22<sup>8, 9</sup></ls>; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to fly; hurl (a curse),
<ls n="lan,49,11">49<sup>11</sup></ls>. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">πέτομαι</lang>, ‘fly’; <lang n="greek">πί-πτω</lang>, ‘fall’;
<ab>Lat.</ab> {%peto,%} ‘fall upon, make for, seek’: see
also {@pattra.@}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ anu,@} fly after, pursue.
<div n="p"/>{@+ ud,@} fly up.
<div n="p"/>{@+ sam-ud,@} fly {%or%} spring up together,
<ls n="lan,3,6">3<sup>6</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,8,14">8<sup>14</sup></ls>.

together; {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} bring together {%or%} convene,
<ls n="lan,9,19">9<sup>19</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ parā,@} fly off, <ls n="lan,93,1">93<sup>1</sup></ls>.

<ls n="lan,69,3">69<sup>3</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,83,10">83<sup>10</sup></ls>; first spoken, <ls n="lan,60,2">60<sup>2</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab> past <ab>pass.</ab>%}
{%<ab>ppl.</ab>%} [<ls n="wg,1291">1291]</ls>: {@dṛṣṭa-pūrva,@} seen before;
{@pūrvam,@} {%<ab>adv.</ab>%} before; beforehand, <ls n="lan,60,9">60<sup>9</sup></ls>;
previously, already, <ls n="lan,7,21">7<sup>21</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,25,17">25<sup>17</sup></ls>; in former
times, <ls n="lan,48,1">48<sup>1</sup></ls>; long ago, <ls n="lan,46,3">46<sup>3</sup></ls>; first, <ls n="lan,103,6">103<sup>6</sup></ls>;
{@pūrvam…uttaram,@} first…last, <ls n="lan,104,12">104<sup>12</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%at end of <ab>cpds</ab>,%} (having…as preceding  <lbinfo n="preced-ing"/>
thing, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) accompanied by…, {%or%}

and {@pra.@}]

‘gentle’; <ab>Goth.</ab> {%freis,%} <ab>acc.</ab> <ab>s.</ab> <ab>m.</ab> {%frijana,%}
<ab>AS.</ab> {%frī,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%frei,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%free:%} although the
modern <ab>mg</ab> ‘free’ is common also to the
<ab>Goth.</ab> and <ab>AS.</ab> words, yet the <ab>orig.</ab> mg
[Page198-b+ 50]
must have been ‘loving {%or%} loved, kindly
treated, spared’ (and so ‘free’), as is
shown by the <ab>Goth.</ab> abstract {%frija-<lang n="greek">ϸ</lang>va,%}
<ab>AS.</ab> {%freōd,%} ‘love’: for <ab>mg</ab> 1b, <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>AS.</ab>

<L>2907<pc>201-a<k1>buD<k2>buD
{@√budh@}¦ ({@bódhati, -te; búdhyate; bubódha,@}

{@-te; buddhá; bóddhum; buddhvā́;@}
{@-búdhya@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} be awake; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} come to
consciousness; {%hence%} <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} notice; give
heed to, {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>gen.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,76,12">76<sup>12</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} notice, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}

understand; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} {%rarely,%} ({%like <ab>Eng.</ab>%} remember  <lbinfo n="re-member"/>
a person, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) presént a person
with a thing {%(<ab>instr.</ab>); --<ab>caus.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—6a.@} cause
to notice {%or%} understand; <div n="2"/>{@—6b.@} teach;
announce to.
<div n="1"/>[for {@*bhudh,@} <ab>orig.</ab> ‘be awake,’ <ab>cf.</ab>
Church Slavonic {%bŭd-ĕti,%} ‘be awake’: the
cognate words of the related lauguages
agree closely in form, but show considerable  <lbinfo n="consider-able"/>
diversity of <ab>mg</ab>s: <ab>mg</ab> 4 mediates
the transition to the idea of the Greek
<lang n="greek">√πυθ, *φυθ</lang>, in <lang n="greek">πυθέσθαι</lang>, ‘find out’: <ab>mg</ab>s 5
and 6 form the bridge to the principal
Germanic <ab>mg</ab>s, ‘offer’ and ‘command’:
<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Goth.</ab> {%ana-biud-an,%} (<ab>prob.</ab> ‘give notice
to,’ and so) ‘command,’ <ab>AS.</ab> {%beōd-an,%}
‘announce, offer, command,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%bid,%}
‘announce, offer in words, offer {%in general,%}
{%<ab>esp.</ab>%} at an auction, declare, proclaim, command, <lbinfo n="com-mand,"/>
 invite,’ <ab>Ger.</ab> {%biet-en,%} ‘offer’; (from
an entirely different root is <ab>Eng.</ab> {%bid,%} <ab>AS.</ab>
{%biddan,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%bitten,%} ‘pray,’ as in {%bid beads,%}
‘pray prayers’;) <ab>cf.</ab> also <ab>Eng.</ab> noun {%bode,%}
‘announcement,’ whence <ab>denom.</ab> verb
{%bode,%} ‘foretell’: for <ab>mg</ab> 5, observe the
analogy of <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Jemand bedenken,%} ‘remember  <lbinfo n="‘re-member"/>
{%or%} take notice of a person {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} in
one's will, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} make a bequest to.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ ni,@} attend to, <ls n="lan,58,1">58<sup>1</sup></ls>; understand, know,
<ls n="lan,7,9">7<sup>9</sup></ls>.

<L>2950<pc>203-b<k1>Baj<k2>Baj
{@√bhaj@}¦ ({@bhájati, -te; babhā́ja, bhejé@} [<ls n="wg,794">794e</ls>];
{@ábhākṣīt, ábhakta@} [<ls n="wg,883">883]</ls>; {@bhajiṣyáti, -te;@}
{@bhaktá; bháktum; bhaktvā́; -bhájya;@}
{%<ab>caus.</ab>%} {@bhājáyati@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} deal out; apportion; <lbinfo n="appor-tion;"/>
 divide; {%then%} ({%as <ab>Eng.</ab>%} share {%means%}
{%both%} ‘give a part of’ {%and%} ‘have a part of’)
<div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%middle,%} have as one's part, receive;
have {%or%} take part in; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} give one's self
up to; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} (choose as one's part, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) declare  <lbinfo n="de-clare"/>
one's self for, prefer, <ls n="lan,15,3">15<sup>3</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} betake  <lbinfo n="be-take"/>
one's self to; turn to; go to, <ls n="lan,20,10">20<sup>10</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—6.@} belong to, be attached to; revere;
[Page204-a+ 50]
love, <ls n="lan,9,20">9<sup>20</sup></ls>; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to have a share,
{%w <ab>acc.</ab> of person and <ab>gen.</ab> of thing,%} <ls n="lan,83,8">83<sup>8</sup></ls>.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">φαγ-εῖν</lang>, ‘get one's portion, eat,’
<ab>w.</ab> a specialization of <ab>mg</ab> like those seen
in <ab>Eng.</ab> {%partake%} and {%take%} as used with the
implied object {%food%} or {%drink,%} in {@bhakta,@}
‘thing divided, portion, food,’ and in
{@bhakṣ:@} akin are the names of the two
food-trees yielding eatable nuts (acorns,
buck-mast), <lang n="greek">φᾱγός, φηγός</lang>, ‘oak,’ <ab>Lat.</ab> {%fāgus,%}
‘beech,’ <ab>AS.</ab> {%bōc,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%buck-,%} ‘beech-,’ in
{%buck-mast,%} ‘beech-nuts,’ and {%buck-wheat%} (so
called from the likeness of the kernels to
beech-nuts), <ab>AS.</ab> {%bēce,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%beech:%} with {%bōc,%}
‘beech,’ is <ab>ident.</ab> {%bōc,%} ‘book,’ <ab>orig.</ab> ‘runes
scratched on branches of a fruit-bearing
tree,’ see Tacitus, Germania, x.; such a
branch was called by a name which became
in Old High <ab>Ger.</ab> {%puah-stap%} or {%buoh-stab,%}
and meant <ab>orig.</ab> ‘beech-staff’; but the
word came to be used for the significant
thing on the branch, ‘the rune {%or%} letter,’
AS {%bōc-stæf,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Buch-stabe.%}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ ā,@} {%<ab>act.</ab>, sometimes <ab>mid.</ab>,%} deal out to, give
a person ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}) a share in a thing ({%<ab>loc.</ab>%}).
<div n="p"/>{@+ vi,@} part asunder; divide.
<div n="p"/>{@+ pra-vi,@} divide.
<div n="p"/>{@+ saṃ-vi,@} --1. divide a thing ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%})
with a person ({%<ab>instr.</ab>%}); give a share;
<div n="2"/>{@—2.@} present a person ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}) with a thing
({%<ab>instr.</ab>%}).

‘light-bringing’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%horn-bora,%} ‘hornbearing, <lbinfo n="‘horn-bearing,"/>

and {%weight,%} ‘burden,’ then ‘mass,’ then

<L>3014<pc>206-b<k1>Buj<k2>Buj<h>1
{@√1bhuj@}¦ ({@bhujáti; bhugná; -bhújya@}).
bend; turn; make crooked. [so far as
the meaning goes, the following words
may well be taken as cognate: <lang n="greek">φυγ-εῖν</lang>,
<ab>Lat.</ab> {%fug-ere,%} ‘turn about, flee’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%būg-an,%}
‘bend, turn about’ (<ab>intrans.</ab>), sometimes
also ‘flee,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> verb {%bow%} (as in {%bow down%}),
‘bend’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%boga,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%bow,%} ‘arcus,’ {%el-bow,%}
{%rain-bow;%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%bieg-sam,%} ‘pliable,’ Old <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%būh-sum,%} ‘pliable, yielding,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%buxom,%}
‘lithe, lively, vigorous’: but the Germanic  <lbinfo n="Ger-manic"/>
{%g%} raises phonetic difficulties which
are not yet satisfactorily cleared up.]
<LEND>
<L>3015<pc>206-b<k1>Buj<k2>Buj<h>2
{@√2bhuj@}¦ ({@bhunákti, bhuṅkté; bubhója,@}
{@bubhujé; ábhujat; bhokṣyáti, -te;@}
{@bhuktá; bhóktum; bhuktvā́@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} enjoy; <lbinfo n="en-joy;"/>
 {%in Veda,%} (have use with, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) have
the use of a thing ({%and so <ab>w.</ab> <ab>instr.</ab>%});
<div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%in later <ab>Skt.</ab>%} ({%like <ab>Ger.</ab>%} geniessen, {%<ab>cf.</ab>%}
{%also%} {@bhoga@} {%and%} {@bhojana@}), enjoy {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} food,
[Page207-a+ 50]
{%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>acc.</ab>;%} <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%without object,%} take one's
meal; {%then%} <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} enjoy (things that are
not food), {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>acc.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,10,9">10<sup>9</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} reap the fruit
(of sin) at the hands of a person ({%<ab>gen.</ab>%}),
<ls n="lan,79,17">79<sup>17</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—6.@} {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to take food, feed.
[if for {@*bhruj@} (but this is doubtful--see
{@√bhañj@}), then <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab> {%frui, *frugvi,%} ‘have
use with’ (a thing, hence <ab>instr.</ab>-<ab>abl.</ab>),
‘enjoy’; {%frug-es,%} ‘fruit’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%brūcan,%}
‘enjoy’ (food or drink), ‘use,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%brook,%}
<ab>orig.</ab> ‘use,’ now ‘put up with.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ anu,@} reap the fruit (of good {%or%} evil
deeds).
<div n="p"/>{@+ upa,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} enjoy, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} (enjoy food, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%})
eat; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} reap the fruit (of good {%or%} evil
deeds).
<LEND>

<L>3046<pc>208-b<k1>Bf<k2>Bf
{@√bhṛ@}¦ ({@bíbharti@} [<ls n="wg,645">645]</ls>; {@bhárati, -te;@} {%<ab>V.</ab>%}
{@jabhā́ra, jabhré@} [<ls n="wg,789">789b</ls>]; {%later,%} {@babhā́ra;@}
{@ábhārṣīt; bhariṣyáti; bhṛtá; bhártum;@}
{@-bhṛ́tya@}). bear ({%<ab>cf.</ab> the various senses of%}
bear {%in <ab>Eng.</ab>%}): {%thus,%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} hold, {%and so%} possess; <lbinfo n="pos-sess;"/>
 <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} bear (in the womb); {@abharat,@}
she bare, <ls n="lan,85,15">85<sup>15</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} endure; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} carry,
convey; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} (bear, {%<ab>i. e.</ab> as in Latimer%})

<ab>Eng.</ab> {%mouse;%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Maus,%} ‘mouse’ (whence
<ab>denom.</ab> {%mausen,%} ‘steal,’ in which we are
brought back again to the <ab>orig.</ab> <ab>mg</ab> of
the primitive), and also ‘muscle of the
thumb’; further, <lang n="greek">μυῖα, *μυσια</lang>, <ab>Lat.</ab> {%mus-ca,%}
‘fly’: see also muṣka.]
<LEND>

<L>3389<pc>222-b<k1>yaTA<k2>ya/TA
{@yáthā,@}¦ {%rel. <ab>adv.</ab> and <ab>conj.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} in which
way, as; {%sometimes following its correlative:%}
{@tathā…yathā,@} <ls n="lan,22,14">22<sup>14</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,43,20">43<sup>20</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,44,20">44<sup>20</sup></ls>; {@evam@}
{@…yathā,@} <ls n="lan,37,8">37<sup>8</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%but much oftener preceding %} <lbinfo n="pre-ceding"/>
{%its correlative:%} {@teṣāṃ saṃ hanmo@}
{@akṣāṇi, yathā_idaṃ harmiaṃ, tathā,@}
of them we close the eyes, as (we close)
this house, so, <ls n="lan,77,13">77<sup>13</sup></ls>; {%so%} <ls n="lan,61,6">61<sup>6</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,27,14">27<sup>14</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,21,16, 18">21<sup>16, 18</sup></ls>,

{@…eva@} ({%Vedic%}), <ls n="lan,86,12, 13">86<sup>12, 13</sup></ls>;
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%correlative omitted:%} {@buddhim prakuruṣva,@} <lbinfo n="pra-kuruṣva,"/>

<L>3488<pc>227-b<k1>rajas<k2>ra/jas
{@rájas,@}¦ {%<ab>n.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} atmosphere, air, region of
clouds, vapors, and gloom, clearly distinguished  <lbinfo n="dis-tinguished"/>
from heaven ({@dyaus,@} <ls n="lan,72,2">72<sup>2</sup></ls>) or
[Page228-a+ 50]
the ethereal spaces of heaven ({@rocanā@}

dwelleth,” these being beyond the {@rajas,@}
just as the <lang n="greek">αἰθήρ</lang> is beyond the <lang n="greek">ἀήρ</lang>;

<L>3500<pc>228-b<k1>raB<k2>raB
{@√rabh@}¦ ({@rábhate; rebhé; árabdha; rapsyáte;@} <lbinfo n="raps-yáte;"/>
{@rabdhá; rábdhum; -rábhya@}).
grasp; take hold of. [<ab>prob.</ab> a collateral
form of {@√grabh,@} and <ab>ident.</ab> <ab>w.</ab> {@labh,@} see
these: <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">τὰ λἀφ-υρα</lang>, ‘spoils, booty’;
<lang n="greek">εἴ-ληφ-α</lang>, ‘took’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%lab-or,%} ‘undertaking,
labor’; perhaps <lang n="greek">ἦλφ-ον</lang>, ‘gat, earned.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ ā,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} take hold upon; touch, <ab>RV.</ab>
x. <ls n="wg,125">125.</ls> 8; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} take hold of, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} undertake, <lbinfo n="under-take,"/>
 <ls n="lan,14,6">14<sup>6</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@yatnam,@} undertake an effort,
{%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} exert one's self, <ls n="lan,11,2">11<sup>2</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} ({%like <ab>Ger.</ab>%}
an-fangen {%and <ab>Lat.</ab>%} in-cipere) begin;
{@ārabhya:@} {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>abl.</ab>,%} beginning from…, {%or%}
{%simply%} from…, <ls n="lan,39,13">39<sup>13</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@adya,@} from today  <lbinfo n="to-day"/>
on, <ls n="lan,36,19">36<sup>19</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ anv-ā,@} take hold of from behind,
hold on to.
<div n="p"/>{@+ sam-anv-ā,@} hold on to each other
(said of several); {@sam-anv-ārabdha,@}
touching.
<div n="p"/>{@+ sam-ā,@} undertake ({%see%} {@ā-rabh@}) together. <lbinfo n="to-gether."/>

dance, battle, <ab>etc.</ab>), hold together; take

<L>3546<pc>230-b<k1>ric<k2>ric
{@√ric@}¦ ({@riṇákti; rícyate@} [<ls n="wg,761">761b</ls>]; {@riréca,@}
{@riricé; áraikṣīt, árikta; rekṣyáti; riktá;@} <lbinfo n="rik-tá;"/>
{%<ab>pass.</ab>%} {@ricyáte;@} {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} {@recáyati@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@}
leave; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} let go, let free; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%very%}
{%rarely%} ({%like <ab>Eng.</ab> <ab>colloq.</ab>%} part with), sell.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>w.</ab> {@riṇákti@} <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab> {%linquit,%} ‘leaves’:
<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἔ-λιπ-ε</lang>, ‘left’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%lic-et,%} ‘it is left, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}
permitted’ (<ab>Eng.</ab> {%leave%} means ‘permission’); <lbinfo n="‘permis-sion’);"/>
 <ab>AS.</ab> {%leōn, *lih-an,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%leih-en,%} ‘leave
a thing to a person for a time, einem
etwas überlassen, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} lend’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%lǣn,%}
‘gift, loan,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> noun {%loan,%} whence <ab>denom.</ab>
verb {%loan;%} <ab>fr.</ab> {%lǣn%} comes {%lǣnan,%} ‘give,
loan,’ Old <ab>Eng.</ab> {%lēn-en,%} preterit {%lēn-de,%}
whose {%d%} has become part of the root in
<ab>Eng.</ab> {%lend%} (though good usage has not
sanctioned the precisely similar blunder
in {%drownd-ed%}).]

determinant {%at%} <ls n="lan,58,23">58<sup>23</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} ({%like <ab>Eng.</ab>%}
designation) name, <ls n="lan,57,14">57<sup>14</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} form,
kind, <ls n="lan,65,12">65<sup>12</sup></ls>. [<ab>fr.</ab> the <ab>denom.</ab> {@lakṣaya@}

{%weth-er:%} for <ab>mg</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">χίμαρος</lang>, ‘goat,’ <ab>prop.</ab>
‘winter-ling’ (see {@hima@}): see {@vatsara.@}]

<div n="1"/>[for {@*vagh:@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ὄχος, *ϝοχος</lang>, ‘wagon’;
<lang n="greek">ὀχέομαι</lang>, ‘ride’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%veh-ere,%} ‘carry’; {%vehiculum,%} <lbinfo n="vehi-culum,"/>

{@bhara@}); <ab>AS.</ab> {%wægn%} or {%wǣn,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%wain,%}
Dutch {%wagen%} (whence the borrowed <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%wagon%}), ‘that which is drawn, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} wagon’;
further, <ab>Lat.</ab> {%vi-a, ve-a, *veh-ia,%} ‘that which
is to be travelled over, way’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%weg,%}
<ab>Eng.</ab> {%way,%} ‘that which carries’ one to a
place.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ ā,@} bring hither {%or%} to.
<div n="p"/>{@+ ud,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} bear {%or%} bring up; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%<ab>esp.</ab>%}
lead out (a bride from her father's house),
wed.
<div n="p"/>{@+ pari,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} lead about; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} lead
about (the bride {%or%} the wedding procession), <lbinfo n="proces-sion),"/>
 wed.
<div n="p"/>{@+ pra,@} carry onward.
[Page241-a+ 50]
<div n="p"/>{@+ vi,@} lead away, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} the bride from her
parents’ house, {%and so%} wed, marry; {%<ab>mid.</ab>%}
get married.
<div n="p"/>{@+ sam,@} carry together; carry.
<LEND>

<L>3771<pc>241-a<k1>vA<k2>vA<h>1
{@√1vā@}¦ ({@vā́ti; vavaú; ávāsīt@} [<ls n="wg,882">882]</ls>; {@vāsyáti;@} <lbinfo n="vās-yáti;"/>
{@vātá; vā́tum; vāpáyati@} [<ls n="wg,1042">1042d</ls>]).
blow. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἄημι, *ἀ-ϝη-μι</lang>, ‘blow’; <ab>Goth.</ab>
{%va-ian,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%weh-en,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%wāwan,%} ‘blow’;
<lang n="greek">αὔ-ρα</lang>, ‘breeze’; <lang n="greek">ἀήρ, *ἀϝηρ</lang>, ‘air’; <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%ventu-s%} (a participial form which has
made a transition to the vowel-declension
--<ab>cf.</ab> {@vasanta@} and <ls n="wg,1172">1172<sup>3, 4</sup></ls>), ‘wind,’ <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%wind;%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%we-der,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%wea-ther,%} ‘wind
(<ab>e. g.</ab> in {%weather-cock%}), condition of the air’:
see {@vā́ta@} and {@vāyú,@} ‘wind.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ ā,@} blow hither.
<div n="p"/>{@+ nis,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} (blow out, {%intransitively, <ab>i. e.</ab>%})
go out, be extinguished; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%<ab>intrans.</ab>%}
(blow till one gets one's breath, {%and so%})
cool off; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} extinguish; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@}
cool off, {%transitively, <ab>i. e.</ab>%} refresh.
<div n="p"/>{@+ parā,@} blow away.
<div n="p"/>{@+ pra,@} blow {%or%} move forward, {%<ab>intrans.</ab>%}
<div n="p"/>{@+ vi,@} blow asunder, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} scatter to the
winds.
<LEND>

<L>3845<pc>243-b<k1>vid<k2>vid<h>1
{@√1vid@}¦ ({@vétti; véda@} [<ls n="wg,790">790a</ls>]; {@ávedīt;@}
{@vediṣyáti, -te; vetsyáti, -te; viditá;@}
{@véditum, véttum; viditvā́; -vídya; vedáyati@} <lbinfo n="ve-dáyati"/>
). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} know; understand; perceive; <lbinfo n="per-ceive;"/>
 ya evaṃ veda, who knoweth thus,
who hath this knowledge, {%frequent formula%}
{%in the Brāhmanas,%} <ls n="lan,97,3">97<sup>3</sup></ls>; {@vidyāt,@} one should
know, it should be known {%or%} understood;
<div n="2"/>{@—2.@} recognize as; {@nalam māṃ viddhi,@}
[Page244-a+ 50]
recognize me as <ab>N.</ab>, know that I am <ab>N.</ab>;
<div n="2"/>{@—3.@} notice; be mindful of, <ls n="lan,75,13">75<sup>13</sup></ls>; bethink
one's self, <ls n="lan,94,6, 10">94<sup>6, 10</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} believe; assume;
consider a person ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}) to be…({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}),
<ls n="lan,43,19">43<sup>19</sup></ls>; {%--<ab>ppl.</ab>%} {@vidvā́ṃs,@} {%see <ab>s. v.</ab>%}
<div n="1"/>[with {@véda, vidmá,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">οἶδα, ἴδμεν</lang>, <ab>AS.</ab>
{%ic wāt, wē witon,%} ‘I know, we know’; <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%I wot,%} gerund {%to wit,%} noun {%wit,%} ‘understanding’:  <lbinfo n="‘under-standing’:"/>
<ab>cf.</ab> also <lang n="greek">εἶδον, *ἐϝιδον</lang>, ‘saw’;
<ab>Lat.</ab> {%vidēre,%} ‘see’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%wītan,%} ‘see’;
whence {%wīt-ga,%} ‘seer, soothsayer, wizard’
(Icelandie {%vit-ki,%} ‘wizard’), {%wicca,%} ‘wizard,’
{%wicce,%} ‘witch,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%witch,%} <ab>masc.</ab> and <ab>fem.</ab>:
{@véda@} is an old preterito-present, ‘have
seen {%or%} perceived,’ and so, ‘know’--see
{@√2vid:@} the forms of the other tensesystems  <lbinfo n="tense-systems"/>
are comparatively modern.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ anu,@} know along, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} from one end to
the other, know thoroughly.
<div n="p"/>{@+ ni,@} {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to know; do to wit;
announce; communicate.

<L>3920<pc>246-b<k1>viS<k2>viS
{@√viś@}¦ ({@viśáti, -te; vivéśa, viviśé; ávikṣat;@}
{@vekṣyáti, -te; viṣṭá; véṣṭum; -víśya;@}
{@veśáyati@}). settle down; go in; go into,
enter. [with veśá, ‘house,’ <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">οἶκος</lang>,

settlement, farm’: see further {@viś@} and

{@āviṣṭa:@} {%actively,%} having entered; {%passively,%}
entered by, filled with; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to
go into, put into, communicate.
<div n="p"/>{@+ upa,@} settle down upon; sit down;
{@upaviṣṭa,@} seated.
<div n="p"/>{@+ ni,@} {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} go in; go home (to house {%or%}
nest); settle down to rest.
<div n="p"/>{@+ abhi-ni,@} settle down to; be inclined
towards, {%<ab>fig.</ab>, as in <ab>Eng.</ab>;%} be bent upon.

<L>3921<pc>246-b<k1>viS<k2>vi/S
{@víś@}¦ ({@víṭ, víśam, viḍbhís@} [<ls n="wg,218">218<sup>3</sup></ls>]), {%<ab>f.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} a
settlement, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} dwelling-place; {%and so%}
house; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} a settlement, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} the community, <lbinfo n="com-munity,"/>
[Page247-a+ 50]

peoples, {%<ab>i. e.</ab> simply%} prince; tribe {%or%} host
(of gods), <ls n="lan,71,18">71<sup>18</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,78,4">78<sup>4</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} the folk, as
distinguished from the Brahmans and
Kshatriyas, the third caste, later called
{@vaiśya;@} a man of the third caste, <ls n="lan,59,22">59<sup>22</sup></ls>.
[{@√viś,@} <ab>q. v.</ab>: <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">Δωριέες τριχά-ικ-ες</lang>, ‘three-tribed  <lbinfo n="‘three-tribed"/>

<L>3970<pc>248-b<k1>vI<k2>vI<h>1
{@√1vī@}¦ ({@véti; vivā́ya, vivyé; vītá@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@}
seek eagerly; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} accept gladly; enjoy;
<div n="2"/>{@—3.@} strive to get; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} fall upon.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab> {%vēnāri,%} ‘hunt,’ a <ab>denom.</ab> of
{%*vē-na,%} ‘hunt’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%wā-<lang n="greek">ð</lang>,%} ‘hunt’; Old
High <ab>Ger.</ab> {%weida,%} ‘1. the seeking, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} of
food, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} hunting, fishing, {%and then%} 2. place
for getting food, pasture, {%and%} 3. food,
fodder’; {%weida%} appears <ab>w.</ab> <ab>mg</ab> 1 in <ab>Ger.</ab>
{%Waid-mann,%} ‘hunter’ (also as family
name, {%Weidmann,%} ‘Hunter’), and <ab>w.</ab> <ab>mg</ab>s
2 and 3 in {%Weide,%} ‘pasture, food’: perhaps  <lbinfo n="per-haps"/>
{@2váyas,@} ‘food,’ <ab>q. v.</ab>, comes <ab>fr.</ab> {@√vī@}
in <ab>mg</ab> 1, ‘seek for, hunt,’ and in this case
the development of <ab>mg</ab> is like that of
{%weida%} 3 and like that of <ab>Lat.</ab> {%vēnātiōn-em,%}
‘hunting, game,’ whence <ab>Eng.</ab> {%venison.%}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ upa,@} seek after.
<LEND>

<L>3985<pc>249-a<k1>vf<k2>vf<h>1
{@√1vṛ@}¦ {@(vṛṇóti, vṛṇuté; vavā́ra, vavré;@}
{@ávārīt; vṛtá; váritum, vártum; vṛtvā́;@}
{@-vṛ́tya; vāráyati). --1.@} cover, enclose,
encompass; surround, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} guard, <ls n="lan,11,21">11<sup>21</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%offensively,%} keep in, hold back {%or%}
captive; {@vṛta,@} pent up, <ls n="lan,75,14">75<sup>14</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%defensively,%} <lbinfo n="de-fensively,"/>
hold back, keep in check (<ls n="lan,75,11">75<sup>11</sup></ls>),
ward off, hinder, restrain; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%}
[<ls n="wg,1041">1041<sup>2</sup></ls>], keep back, hinder, stop.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἐ-ελ-μένος</lang>, ‘enclosed’ and ‘held in
check,’ referred to <lang n="greek">εἴλω</lang>, Aeolic <lang n="greek">ἔλλω</lang>,
<lang n="greek">*ϝελ-νω; εἶλαρ, *ϝελ-αρ</lang>, ‘cover, defense’;
<ab>Lat.</ab> {%ver-ēri,%} ‘be on one's guard, fear’;
{%vellus,%} ‘(cover, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) pelt, fleece’; {%vallum,%}
‘defense, palisaded rampart, wall,’ whence
the borrowed <ab>Eng.</ab> {%wall;%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%ware, wary,%}
‘on one's guard, cautious’; <ab>Ger.</ab> {%wehren,%}
‘check, ward off’; {%Wehre,%} ‘defense’;
with {@vártra,@} ‘stopping,’ and then ‘a dam,’
cf <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Wehr,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%wer,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%weir,%} ‘(water-)
stop, dam’: for other cognates, see {@uru,@}
{@ūrṇa, varuṇa:@} <ab>cf.</ab> the derivs {@vala, vṛtra,@}
{@varūtha, varṇa,@} <ab>etc.</ab>]
<div n="p"/>{@+ anu,@} cover over.
<div n="p"/>{@+ apa,@} uncover, open. [<ab>cf.</ab> the relation
of <ab>Ger.</ab> {%decken,%} ‘cover,’ and {%auf-decken,%}
‘uncover.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ abhi,@} cover.

(covered with, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) filled with, provided
with, <ls n="lan,66,1">66<sup>1</sup></ls>.

{%<ab>caus.</ab>%} [<ls n="wg,1041">1041<sup>2</sup></ls>], stop, <ls n="lan,98,4">98<sup>4</sup></ls>.

{%or%} in order, {%and so%} put in order,

<L>4011<pc>251-a<k1>vfD<k2>vfD
{@√vṛdh@}¦ ({@várdhati, -te; vavárdha, vavṛdhé;@} <lbinfo n="va-vṛdhé;"/>
{@ávṛdhat, ávardhiṣṭa; vartsyáti;@}
[Page251-b+ 50]
{@vṛddhá; várdhitum; vardháyati, -te@}).
{%<ab>act.</ab> <ab>trans.</ab>:%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} elevate, make to grow,
make greater, strengthen; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%<ab>fig.</ab>%} elevate  <lbinfo n="ele-vate"/>
inwardly, excite pleasantly, cheer,
inspire ({%<ab>cf.</ab> the metaphor in slang <ab>Eng.</ab>%} high,
‘slightly intoxicated’), {%used%} of the effects
which the homage and sacrifices of men
are supposed to have on the gods;
<div n="1"/>{%--<ab>mid.</ab> <ab>intrans.</ab>:%} <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} grow, <ls n="lan,24,3">24<sup>3</sup></ls>; thrive,
<ls n="lan,69,16">69<sup>16</sup></ls>; {@vardhate,@} he thrives, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} it goes
well with him, <ls n="lan,65,2">65<sup>2</sup></ls>; grow strong {%or%} greater
{%or%} mighty, <ls n="lan,81,2">81<sup>2</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,82,3">82<sup>3</sup></ls>; increase, <ls n="lan,8,11">8<sup>11</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,60,19">60<sup>19</sup></ls>;
--4. {%<ab>fig.</ab>%} be pleasantly excited, take delight  <lbinfo n="de-light"/>
in; be inspired;
<div n="1"/>{%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} make to grow; make
strong; bring up (a child), <ls n="lan,46,8">46<sup>8</sup></ls>; increase,
{%<ab>trans.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,64,21">64<sup>21</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%<ab>fig.</ab>%} excite pleasantly,
cheer, inspire; {%--distinction between the%}
{%physical and <ab>fig.</ab> <ab>mg</ab>s not always to be made,%}
{%so%} <ls n="lan,80,19">80<sup>19</sup></ls>.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">βλάστη, *ϝλαθ-τη</lang>, ‘growth, a shoot,’
<lang n="greek">βλαστάνω</lang>, ‘grow’; <lang n="greek">ὀρθός, *ϝορθος</lang>, ‘upright’; <lbinfo n="‘up-right’;"/>

‘(sacred) twig.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ pra,@} grow on, grow up; {@pravṛddha,@}
({%like <ab>Lat.</ab>%} altus) exalted.

up; nourish, feed.

<L>4013<pc>251-b<k1>vfz<k2>vfz
{@√vṛṣ@}¦ ({@várṣati, -te; vavárṣa, vavṛṣé;@}
{@ávarṣīt; varṣiṣyáti, -te; vṛṣṭá; várṣitum;@} <lbinfo n="várṣi-tum;"/>
{@vṛṣṭvā́, -vṛ́ṣya@}). rain; {@várṣati@}
[<ls n="wg,303">303b</ls>], <lang n="greek">ὕοντος</lang>, while it is raining. [<ab>orig.</ab>,
perhaps, more general, ‘to pour down,’
<ab>esp.</ab> either the fructifying water of heaven
(<ab>masc.</ab>) upon the earth (<ab>fem.</ab>), or semen
of the bull or male animal upon the
female: with {@varṣa,@} ‘rain,’ <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἔ-ερσαι</lang>,
‘rain-drops’; with {@vṛṣan@} and {@vṛṣabha,@}
‘bull,’ <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab> {%verres, *vers-es,%} ‘boar,’ so
named from his great generative power,
just as the sow (see {@sū́@}) from her fecundity. <lbinfo n="fe-cundity."/>
]

<L>4274<pc>260-b<k1>Srad<k2>Sra/d
{@śrád,@}¦ {%<ab>indecl.</ab> meaning perhaps <ab>orig.</ab>%} heart;
{%used <ab>w.</ab>%} {@dhā@} (‘grant, give,’ {%see%} {@√1dhā@} 4)
{%and <ab>dat.</ab> of person, thus,%} {@śrád asmai@}
{@dhatta,@} (your) heart to him give ye, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}
trust ye him, have faith in him, <ab>RV.</ab> ii.
12. 5; {%<ab>ppl.</ab>%} {@śrad-dadhat,@} trusting, trustful,
<ls n="lan,26,2">26<sup>2</sup></ls>; {%<ab>cf.</ab>%} <ls n="wg,1079">1079<sup>2</sup></ls>.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">καρδία, *κηρδ</lang>, <ab>Lat.</ab> {%cor,%} <ab>gen.</ab>
{%cord-is,%} Lithuanian {%szirdìs,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Herz,%} <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%heart:%} further, <ab>w.</ab> {@śrad-dhā,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%crēdĕre, *cred-dere,%} ‘trust’: --the regular
<ab>Skt.</ab> word for ‘heart’ is {@hṛ́d,@} and this can
not be connected <ab>w.</ab> the above words,
since they require in the <ab>Skt.</ab> an initial {@ś,@}
{@*śṛd@} or {@śrad.@}]

{%seneschal;%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Sünd-flut,%} ‘sin-flood,’ is a

<ls n="lan,50,20">50<sup>20</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,95,18">95<sup>18</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,96,2">96<sup>2</sup></ls>; salvus, integer, unharmed; <lbinfo n="un-harmed;"/>

{%common to the post-Vedic literature; that in%}
{%the oldest parts of the Veda,%} {@sarva@} {%occurs%}
{%only in <ab>mg</ab>%} 1, {%while for <ab>mg</ab>%} 2 {%the proper%}
{%Vedic word is%} {@víśva,@} {%<ab>q. v.</ab>; but see%} <ls n="lan,77,11">77<sup>11</sup></ls><ab>N.</ab>
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ὅλος</lang>, Epic <lang n="greek">οὖλος, *ὄλλος, *ὅλϝο-ς</lang>,
[Page269-b+ 50]
‘whole, entire’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%salvus,%} ‘whole, unharmed, <lbinfo n="un-harmed,"/>
 well’; Oscan {%sollu-s,%} ‘entire’;
<ab>Lat.</ab> stem {%sollu-%} in <ab>cpds</ab>, <ab>e. g.</ab> {%solli-ferreum,%}
‘all-iron (weapon),’ {%soll-ennis,%} ‘of every

<L>4523<pc>270-a<k1>sah<k2>sah
{@√sah@}¦ ({@sáhate; sasā́ha, sasahé; ásahiṣṭa;@}
{@sahiṣyáte; soḍhá@} [<ls n="wg,222">222<sup>3</sup></ls>]; {@sáhitum, sóḍhum;@} <lbinfo n="só-ḍhum;"/>
{@-sáhya@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} overpower, <ls n="lan,99,8">99<sup>8</sup></ls>;
be victorious, <ls n="lan,78,4">78<sup>4</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} hold out against,
withstand; {%and so%} bear; endure patiently,
<ls n="lan,32,7">32<sup>7</sup></ls>.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>orig.</ab> ‘be powerful, withstand, hold
back, hold’: <ab>cf.</ab> the collateral {@√sagh,@}
‘take on one's self, bear’: <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἴσχω, *σι</lang>-
<lang n="greek">σχ-ω</lang>, ‘hold back’; <lang n="greek">ἔχω, ἔ-σχ-ον</lang>, ‘hold {%or%}
[Page270-b+ 50]
have, had’: --<ab>w.</ab> {@sahas, *sagh-as,@} <ab>cf.</ab> the
Germanic stem {%seg-oz,%} as it appears in
<ab>Goth.</ab> <ab>neut.</ab> {%sigis,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%sigor,%} <ab>prob.</ab> neuter,
all meaning ‘victory’; the stem appears
also in {%Seges-tes,%} name of a Cheruscan
prince (Tacitus, Annals), and in {%Sigismund:%} <lbinfo n="Sigis-mund:%"/>
<ab>cf.</ab> also <ab>AS.</ab> {%sige,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Sieg,%}
‘victory.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ ud,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} hold out, endure; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} be
able, {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>inf.</ab>;%} {@kathaṃ svārtham utsahe,@}
how can I ({%<ab>sc.</ab>%} do, prosecute) my own
object.
<LEND>

<L>4699<pc>276-a<k1>sf<k2>sf
{@√sṛ@}¦ ({@sísarti; sasā́ra, sasré; ásarat; sariṣyáti;@} <lbinfo n="sa-riṣyáti;"/>
{@sṛtá; sártum; sṛtvā́; -sṛ́tya;@}
{@sāráyati, -te@}). run swiftly, glide, flow;
{%<ab>caus.</ab> <ab>act.</ab>%} set in motion. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ὁρ-μή</lang>, ‘rush,
onset, spring,’ whence <lang n="greek">ὁρμάω</lang>, ‘rush on’;
<lang n="greek">ἅλ-μα</lang>, ‘spring’; <lang n="greek">ἅλλομαι</lang>, ‘spring’; <lang n="greek">ἆλ-το</lang>,
‘leaped’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%salīre,%} ‘spring’; <ab>cf.</ab> {@saras,@}
‘pool,’ {@sarit,@} ‘stream,’ and, for the root
with 1, {@sal-ila,@} ‘flowing’ and ‘fluid, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}
water.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ anu,@} run {%or%} go after.
<div n="p"/>{@+ apa,@} go off; {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} remove; take out.
<div n="p"/>{@+ ava,@} go down, {%in%} {@avasara.@}
<div n="p"/>{@+ ā,@} run unto; run.

<L>4740<pc>278-a<k1>stf<k2>stf
{@√stṛ@}¦ ({@stṛṇā́ti, stṛṇīté,@} {%in <ab>mg</ab>%} 1 {%in Veda;%}
{@stṛṇóti, stṛṇuté,@} {%in <ab>mg</ab>%} 2; {@tastā́ra, tastaré;@} <lbinfo n="ta-staré;"/>
{@ástarīt@} [<ls n="wg,900">900]</ls>; {@stariṣyáte; stṛtá,@}
{@stīrṇá@} [<ls n="wg,957">957b</ls>]; {@stṛtvā́, stīrtvā́; -stṛ́tya,@}
{@-stī́rya@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} strew, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} the sacrificial

sternere) overthrow (an enemy).
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">στόρ-νυ-μι</lang>, <ab>Lat.</ab> {%ster-n-ere,%} ‘strew,
spread out’; <lang n="greek">στρῶ-μα</lang>, (like <ab>Eng.</ab> {%spread%})
‘bedding,’ <lang n="greek">στρω-μνή</lang>, ‘bed,’ <ab>Lat.</ab> {%strā-men,%}
‘straw,’ {%storea,%} ‘straw mat,’ {%torus, *stor-u-s,%}
‘bed’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%strea-w, streo-w-ian,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%straw,%}
{%strew;%} <lang n="greek">στρω-τός</lang>, <ab>Lat.</ab> {%strā-tus,%} ‘bespread’;
{%(via) strata,%} ‘(way) bespread’ with stones,
{%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} ‘paved,’ whence borrowed <ab>AS.</ab> {%strǣt,%}
<ab>Eng.</ab> {%street;%} Old <ab>Lat.</ab> {%stlā-tus,%} <ab>Lat.</ab> {%lātus,%}
‘spread out, spreading, {%and so%} broad,
wide’; see also under noun {@stṛ́.@}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ anu,@} cover over.
<div n="p"/>{@+ ā,@} spread out.

{%as technical term of the ritual, with or without%} <lbinfo n="with-out%"/>

({%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} the hand) so as to make a coating,

{@sva-dharma,@}¦ {%<ab>m.</ab>%} own duty.
<LEND>
<L>4807<pc>282-b<k1>svaDA<k2>svaDA/<h>1
{@1svadhā́,@}¦ {%<ab>f.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} wont, habit, custom,
<ls n="lan,76,7">76<sup>7</sup></ls>; rule; <lang n="greek">ἔθος</lang>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} accustomed place,
home, <lang n="greek">ἦθος</lang>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} (wonted condition, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%})
comfort; joy; bliss, <ls n="lan,83,12">83<sup>12</sup></ls>; pleasure, <ls n="lan,73,14">73<sup>14</sup></ls>;
{@svadhā́m ánu nas,@} according to our
pleasure, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} exactly to our wish, <ls n="lan,73,13">73<sup>13</sup></ls>;
{@svadháyā@} {%and%} {@svadhā́bhis:@} in wonted
wise; with pleasure, gladly; (gladly, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%})
willingly, freely, <ls n="lan,84,12">84<sup>12</sup></ls>. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἔθος</lang>, ‘custom,’
<lang n="greek">ἦθος</lang>, ‘wonted place, haunt,’ <lang n="greek">εἴ-ωθ-α</lang>, ‘am accustomed’; <lbinfo n="ac-customed’;"/>
 <ab>AS.</ab> {%sidu,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Sitte,%} ‘custom.’]
<LEND>
<L>4808<pc>282-b<k1>svaDA<k2>svaDA/<h>2
{@2svadhā́,@}¦ {%<ab>f.</ab>%} sweet drink; {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} a libation
of ghee to the Manes. [perhaps for
{@2sudhā:@} for the etymology, <ab>cf.</ab> {@svadhā́ @} <lbinfo n="sva-dhā́"/>
{@adhayat,@} ‘he drank the sweet
drinks,’ <ab>RV.</ab>]
<LEND>

{@svàr@}¦ [<ls n="wg,388">388d</ls>], {%pronounced%} {@súar@} {%in the Veda,%}
{%<ab>n.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} the sun, <ls n="lan,71,19">71<sup>19</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} sunlight, sunshine; <lbinfo n="sun-shine;"/>

one of the three “utterances,” {%see%}
{@vyāhṛti.@}
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">Σείρ-ιος, Σείρ</lang>, ‘sun, dog-star’;

AS {%swel-an,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%sweal,%} ‘burn, glow, waste
away by heat’; and the kindred {%swelter,%}

extended forms of a root {@*su,@} ‘to light,’

<L>4853<pc>284-a<k1>svid<k2>svid
{@√svid@}¦ ({@svédate; svídyati, -te; siṣvidé;@}
{@svinná@}). sweat. [{@svídyāmi@} = <lang n="greek">ἰδίω</lang>, ‘sweat’;
<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἷδός, ἱδ-ρώς</lang>, ‘sweat,’ <lang n="greek">ἱδρόω</lang>, ‘sweat’;
<ab>Lat.</ab> {%sūdā-re,%} ‘sweat,’ <ab>denom.</ab> of {%*sūdu-s,%}
‘sweat’; {%sūd-or,%} ‘sweat’; Lettish {%swidrs,%}
‘sweat’; <ab>AS.</ab> noun {%swāt,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%sweat:%}
observe that though there is a word for
‘sweat’ common to most Indo-European
tongues, there is no such common word
for ‘be chilly.’]

<L>4856<pc>284-a<k1>ha<k2>ha
{@ha,@}¦ {%enclitic and slightly asseverative particle,%}
<ls n="lan,64,4">64<sup>4</sup></ls>; {%in the Veda,%} <ls n="lan,78,15">78<sup>15</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,79,12">79<sup>12</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,92,12">92<sup>12</sup></ls>; {%in the%}
{%Brāhmanas,%} <ls n="lan,94,8">94<sup>8</sup></ls>, {%and very often%} ({%so pages%}
95-6), <ls n="lan,103,15">103<sup>15</sup></ls> {%(quotation from a Brāhmana);%}
{%in the Sūtras,%} to be sure, of course, {%designating %} <lbinfo n="desig-nating"/>
[Page284-b+ 50]
{%that the author agrees with the view%}
{%or method mentioned,%} <ls n="lan,99,19">99<sup>19</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,101,5">101<sup>5</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,103,14, 16">103<sup>14, 16</sup></ls>;
{%--very common at end of half-śloka,%} <ls n="lan,7,15">7<sup>15</sup></ls>;
{%<ab>esp.</ab> after a 3d <ab>sing.</ab> <ab>perf.</ab>%} (<lang n="greek">˘¯˘</lang>), <ls n="lan,9,4">9<sup>4</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,10,2">10<sup>2</sup></ls>;
{%so%} {@iti ha,@} <ls n="lan,12,8">12<sup>8</sup></ls>; {%--combinations:%} {@…iti@}
{@hovāca,@} “…,” he said, <ls n="lan,61,18">61<sup>18</sup></ls>; {%so%} {@hovāca,@}
{@hocus,@} <ls n="lan,95,18">95<sup>18</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,96,13">96<sup>13</sup></ls>. [this word appears
also as {@gha@} in the Veda: <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">γε</lang>, Doric <lang n="greek">γα</lang>,
enclitic asseveratives.]
<LEND>

<L>4860<pc>284-b<k1>han<k2>han
{@√han@}¦ ({@hánti@} [<ls n="wg,637">637]</ls>; {@jaghā́na@} [<ls n="wg,794">794d</ls>];

<div n="2"/>{@—1.@} strike; strike down; smite {%or%} slay,

<div n="1"/>[with {@hán-mi,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">θείνω, *θεν-ϳω,</lang>, ‘smite’;

<ab>Ger.</ab> {%gun-d,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%gū<lang n="greek">ð</lang>, *gun-<lang n="greek">ð</lang>,%} ‘battle’; <ab>AS.</ab>

<L>4917<pc>287-a<k1>hf<k2>hf<h>1

({%like <ab>Eng.</ab>%} take) charm, captivate; <div n="2"/>{@—8.@}
(carry off, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} remove, {%and so%}) destroy.
[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">χείρ</lang>, dialectic <lang n="greek">χέρ-ς</lang>, ‘hand’; <lang n="greek">εὐ-χερ</lang>-
<lang n="greek">ής</lang>, ‘easy to handle’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%hir,%} ‘hand’;
{%hērēs,%} ‘heir,’ see root, <ab>mg</ab> 5.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ ava,@} (carry down, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) move down.
<div n="p"/>{@+ vy-ava,@} move hither and thither, go
to work, proceed, <ab>act.</ab>

of food, take, eat; {%--<ab>desid.</ab>%} be willing to
get back, <ls n="lan,97,10">97<sup>10</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ ud-ā,@} bring out, {%and so%} utter, say, tell.
<div n="p"/>{@+ praty-ā,@} get back again; {%at%} <ls n="lan,11,6">11<sup>6</sup></ls>, {%incorrect %} <lbinfo n="in-correct"/>
{%reading for%} {@pra-vy-ā-.@}
<div n="p"/>{@+ vy-ā,@} bring out, {%and so%} utter;
[Page287-b+ 50]
{%with%} {@vācam,@} speak words to a person  <lbinfo n="per-son"/>
({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,3,1">3<sup>1</sup></ls>; {%similarly,%} <ls n="lan,8,19">8<sup>19</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ pra-vy-ā,@} utter; speak.
<div n="p"/>{@+ ud,@} take out.
<div n="p"/>{@+ pari,@} carry around.
<div n="p"/>{@+ pra,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} (bring forward, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} reach
out, {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} feet, fists, {%and so%}) strike, attack,
deal blows; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} throw, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} into the fire.
<div n="p"/>{@+ anu-pra,@} throw into the fire {%or%} on a
fuel-pile.

wander about.

withdraw.

one's self, {%<ab>mid.</ab>;%} withdraw.
